column2: few meds, 45-54 Male  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: Worked well the first day, not as effective the second. Did not feel great after taking this but better after I ate.  Oddest effect was difficulty urinating - never had the side effect before

column2: stuffy, 45-54 Female  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: i experienced rapid heart beat, sleeplessness and lack of appetite. Also, many headaches at night. I would not take again

column2: canoe, 65-74 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This drug is ineffective.  The FDA should allow the manufacture of Entex LA which was VERY effective.  I continue to be congested and mucus pours from my nose.  Don't bother using this drug.

column2: CMB, 13-18 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: While this drug did take care of my allergies the side effects were not worth it. This drug caused me to be very jittery and tired all the time. I also experienced loss of appetite and headaches.

column2: nickyj, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I was prescribed this medication for congestion.  I took it @ 9:30pm...while driving to work I became totally disoriented had to pull over.  I went to the ER...I took the med again that night...became completely dizzy and nauseous.  I will not be taking this med again.

column2: Ildito, 35-44 Male  on Treatment for 1 to 6 months (Patient)
column9: uncontrol  high blood pressure, fast heart beat, eyes and ears presusure

column2: 25-34 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: The side effects are far less than other allergy medications I have taken.  Without it my eyes itch constantly in the spring.

I was prescribed this drug for a sinus infection to be taken along with an  antibotic.  It made me feel so wierd..nervous, jittery, strange thoughts, sleeplessness.  It did not clear my sinusus.  I would not recommend.
i was suffering from terrible allergy attacks and horrible allergy symptoms. this stopped it all except for an occasional sneeze every now and then

column2: 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: I started taking this medication because I was constantly losing my voice.  My Doctor said it was most likely due to seasonal allergies, so she perscribed Clarinex-D.  This pill did improve my voice, but the side effects that I experienced were not worth it.  I was jittery, nervous, disoriented, and I could not sleep.  It also gave me very painful headaches.  I went two days with about 3 hours of sleep combined.  That's when I decided to stop the medication.  I would not recommend Clarinex-D to anyone.

column2: mississippimac, 19-24 Female  on Treatment for less than 1 month (Patient)
column9: This medication worked but was definitely not worth it. It kept me up wide awake for 24+ hours. It was the most awful experience. When you are sick you want plenty of rest, not to be up for hours on end unable to sleep.
